meanings.definition: The act or process of measuring or recording the passage of time.
meanings.sent1: Her timekeeping was impeccable, always arriving exactly on time for every meeting.
meanings.sent2: The company's timekeeping system helped ensure that employees were paid accurately for their hours worked.
meanings.sent3: The timekeeping of the clock in the old town square was so bad, it was always either too fast or too slow.
meanings.sent4: In the race of life, good timekeeping can be the difference between success and failure.
meanings.sent5: The timekeeping of the ancient sundial was a marvel of precision, guiding the villagers through their daily routines.

meanings.definition: The practice or system of maintaining a record of time.
meanings.sent1: The timekeeping of the train schedule was crucial for passengers to plan their journeys.
meanings.sent2: The timekeeping of the ancient civilization was done through intricate sundials and water clocks.
meanings.sent3: The timekeeping of the mischievous cat involved knocking over the clock every morning.
meanings.sent4: The timekeeping of the stars in the night sky served as a celestial calendar for ancient astronomers.
meanings.sent5: The timekeeping of the town's bell tower was so accurate, it could be heard miles away to mark the hours.
